com.camerontec.catalys.server.sgx

Class SgxClientConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.sessionmanager.DefaultClientConnectionManager
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.sgx.SgxClientConnectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IClientConnectionManager, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable

    public class SgxClientConnectionManager
extends DefaultClientConnectionManager
    Specialised client connection manager for handling SGX logon requirements.

    At logon the SGX requires authentication credentials be supplied in the logon message via the RawData tag.

    This connection manager uses the configured IPasswordStoreWithMemory to obtain a password for the configured username.

    We do not manage passwords on behalf of SGX clients, however, we do detect when new passwords become active and automatically generate the required password change request to the SGX. This is done via the logon message. In order to be able to do this we also maintain the currently active password on disk for use in triggering password change requests. Amongst other things this means a session can be logged on and off multiple times on a password change day (according to the password service), with only a single password change request sent to the SGX.

    On each successful logon the SGX advertises the number of days remaining for the password used to logon. We use this for logging and optional email notification only, no other action is taken.
